quality_notes: Page 2 is BAD due to severe title page corruption (BLACKWELL, Oxford, Computer)
Page 20 is BAD due to mixed-language content (Greek/German/English) with character loss
Pages 4-6 are MARGINAL primarily due to proper name variants and umlaut rendering
Most GOOD pages have error rates <6% with errors being recognizable character substitutions
Common patterns: line-break fragments appearing as 'unknown words', German/Latin terms correctly OCR'd, umlaut rendering issues
Footnote artifacts suspected on page 9 (ioi) but documented
Overall batch quality is acceptable for RAG (52% GOOD, 43% MARGINAL, 4% BAD)
Errors are concentrated in proper names, foreign language passages, and formatting artifacts
